description.narrative:
Land Research Center will carry out implementation of 2 Km carrier lines and rehabilitation of 2 km agricultural roads in Area C ofJericho. In addition- LRC will carry out legal support and services to the project bnf and the community 1. Beneficiary/Location selection: Selection criteria will be developed in coordination with the MoA. Locations will be selected in coordination with the agriculture directorates. MoA will provide beneficiary lists based on agreed criteria that will include farmers neither receiving support in maintaining their livelihoods from MoA, nor from other actors while women headed families will be prioritized also. Oxfam and its partners will reassess and validate the selected locations. The final list of locations will be shared with MoA and FSS to ensurecoordination, complementarity and transparency. 2. Rehabilitation Works: for road rehabilitation, the followings are the main sub-activities/milestones: - Select agricultural roads with MoA, DoA, local councils and communities - Procure material and services - Carry out road rehabilitation - Monitor delivery and implementation - Handover to municipality/village council 3- Establishment of Carrier Lines: The following are the main sub-activities/milestones: - Coordinate with MoA, FSS and relevant actors to finalize selected locations. - Select and verify selection of vulnerable farmers in line with humanitarian criteria - Identify irrigation waterlines - Procure material and services; - Conduct water mainline rehabilitation;
4- Protection of livelihoods through protection servicesto vulnerable farmers As part of providing vulnerable farmers with the means to protect their livelihoods and empower them to be autonomous and resilient, LRC will provide legal support and legal awareness activities to all beneficiaries (278 HHs) targeted under this project remotely through phone messages and distribution of printed materials. Throughout the project, technical legal assistance will be provided to victims affected by military orders of home demolition and land confiscation, to contribute to neutralizing military orders and limit associated risks. This will be implemented in full coordination with official and non-official legal institutions working in the targeted communities; such as the Jerusalem Legal Aid and Human Rights Center (JLAC); The Society of St. Yves;and the Colonization and Wall Resistance Commission (CWRC). Increasing legal awareness among farmers particularly when it comes to available legal means and measures, will limit and minimize the victims# vulnerability and increase their protection. This will helpmitigate the damage done by the Israeli military demolition orders and practices. It is vital that victims acquire the know how to respond to these military orders and effectively challenge them or at least freeze them

participating-org.narrative:
The Land Research Center # LRC is a non profit organization founded in 1986 in Jerusalem as part of the Arab Studies Society. It aims to enhance the sustainable development in the occupied Palestinian territories through the encouragement of self dependency by controlling <(>&<)> exploiting the Palestinian natural resources and improving technical <(>&<)> scientific capacities of the Palestinian population in regard to optimizing the natural resource management as well as utilizing advanced <(>&<)> adequate technologies.
Furthermore, LRC have more than 25 years experiences on the following fields: 1. Natural Resource Management 2. Water <(>&<)> Environmental Management 3. Remote sensing and Geographical Information System (GIS) 4. Sustainable Agriculture and Biodiversity 5. Social, Economical <(>&<)> Political development in the occupied Palestinian Territories (oPT)
LRC has been one of the major players in Palestinian civil society movement by encouraging cooperation between civil society organizations and international bodies as well as Palestinian National Authority. Programs # Human Rights Program: focuses on monitoring and documentation of Israeli violation against the Palestinian land; water; agriculture; environment and housing rights. # Natural Resources Management Program: focuses on implementing developmental project for land; water; soil; agriculture; environment as will as capacity building <(>&<)> awareness campaign. # Researches and Studies Program: Conducts studies and researches in land; water; soil; agriculture; environment <(>&<)> housing.
Departments # Monitoring Israeli Violations of Human Rights Department. # Sustainable agricultural Department # Water and Environmental Department # Computer <(>&<)> Geographical Information System (GIS) Department
Personal The number of employees in the center is 32 professional qualified staff covering a wide variety of specialty fields.
The staff is divided into two groups of permanent and temporary gender friendly staff. Additionally LRC received a number of localand international volunteers aiding in the center's activities.
Activities
LRC has conducted several researches <(>&<)> studies in addition to implementing numerous developmental <(>&<)> emergency projects.
